description: Mottled light passing through a floor-to-ceiling window of handmade glass illuminates the many intriguing details Narcissa Niblack Thorne included in this miniature room. Above the ornately carved paneling at the back is a door, the entrance for troupes of musicians who might have provided entertainment during a banquet. The portraits and armor that flank the fireplace convey Thorne’s romantic vision of a noble household.
artist_info:
Designed by Narcissa Niblack Thorne
American
1882-1966
title: E-1: English Great Room of the Late Tudor Period, 1550-1603
